Transcript:
Alison: I don't even believe 
what I'm hearing. Please tell me you didn't do this. Please tell me you did not 
actually crawl inside my head and give me this nightmare of Stephen being Caleb. 
Please tell me this, rafe.
Rafe: I'm sorry.

Alison: I dreamt that he bit me 
and that he killed me.

Rafe: I know. I'm sorry. 
Something went wrong. It wasn't supposed to happen this way. The dream -- that 
was supposed to help you.

Alison: How, by scaring me half 
to death?

Rafe: No, I just wanted you to 
see -- I wanted you to see who Caleb is. He's -- he's not your friend. That is 
Caleb. He's not Stephen, ok?

Alison: So -- so let me get 
this straight. You put some sort of spell on me.
Rafe: No --

Alison: You put some sort of 
spell on me with your magical powers that I thought you didn't have anymore.

Rafe: No, I don't -- I don't! 
At least most of the time.
Alison: What does that mean?

Rafe: I don't know. I can't 
really explain it, but it seems like when it comes to you --

Alison: What about when it 
comes to me? What?

Rafe: It -- it seems like when 
-- when it comes to you, when I have really strong feelings, you know, like love 
or concern or anything like that -- when they're really strong, I can tap into 
it. I can tap into the magic. And I thought it was just a fluke at first. I 
turned a yellow rose into a pink one without even trying.
Alison: Oh, my God.

Rafe: And then when your father 
died, I -- I told you I --

Alison: Yeah, I dreamt of him 
in that way and that was all because -- because of you. Yeah.

Rafe: You were so upset, and I 
just -- I wanted to be there for you and I wanted to make you feel better, and 
it worked. But this time --

Alison: What, you thought maybe 
I needed some sort of wake-up call or what?

Rafe: No, I just wanted you to 
see Stephen like I do. He is Caleb, and I need you to stay away from him!

Alison: And you think that that 
makes everything ok, by manipulating me? I can't wait to see what happens when 
down the road you and I get into a disagreement. Are you going to crawl back 
inside my head and make sure that I see things the way you do?
Rafe: No. No --

Alison: Yeah, "no" is right 
because that is brainwashing and controlling. And I'm sorry, but if that is the 
way our future looks, I don't want any part of it.

Lucy: I have to stop it. I have 
-- I've got to stop thinking about him. I've got to stop worrying about Ian. 
He'll be fine. He's going to get through this. He's going to get over everything 
-- over me and move on. That's the way it has to be because I am putting my life 
back together with Kevin. That's all there is to it.
[Lucy sighs]

Lucy: Doc? Kevin? Doc? That's 
funny. I really thought he should be home by now.

Woman: Hey, love, looking for a 
date?

Kevin: As a matter of fact, I 
am. A date that's long overdue.

Woman: No! No, no! Mister, we 
can work this out! Please!
Kevin: Quiet!

Woman: Please, please, don't 
hurt me again!
Please!
Kevin: Quiet.
Woman: I'm begging you!
Kevin: Quiet! Shut up.
Woman: Let me go! Let me go.
Kevin: I can't do that.
Woman: Let me go.

Kevin: I can't do that. You 
see, I'm just getting my life back together, and going to jail -- well, that 
doesn't fit into my plans.

Livvie: What's the matter, 
Stephen? Come on, this can't be the first time a big rock star like you has come 
home to find a naked woman in his bed.

Stephen: You are full of 
surprises, aren't you?

Livvie: Yeah. I'm just one big 
surprise after another, so why don't you join me and I'll show you.
Stephen: Look, Livvie --

Livvie: No, no. Please, don't 
call me that. Call me what you always have, what you called me earlier. The 
minute you said it, that's when I knew it was you, Caleb. Call me Olivia. Your 
sweet Olivia.

[Captioning made possible by 
abc, inc.]

Rafe: Alison, please listen to 
me.
Alison: No --
Rafe: Please --

Alison: No, Rafe, you -- you 
need to listen to me. This obsession that you have with Stephen being Caleb has 
got you so turned around, you can't even see how insane your behavior is. 
There's nothing that can justify what you did.

Rafe: I know. I know that now, 
all right? I -- I'd rather cut off my arm than put you through that nightmare, 
ok? I would!

Alison: I'm not just talking 
about the nightmare!
Rafe: What do you mean, then?

Alison: Don't you remember the 
promise that you made to me the night that you came back to me on that train? Do 
you remember? You told me that we were through with the magic. We were just 
going to put it aside and you and I were going to be a normal couple, like 
normal people. We were going to do normal things. Do you remember that? Do you 
remember that promise?
Rafe: Yeah, yeah.

Alison: Good, because I do, 
too, and I cherish that promise because it's -- it's about everything that we're 
working towards -- our future, our life together, our marriage. And now I feel 
like the whole thing has just crumbled into a thousand pieces and all I'm left 
with is a bunch of chaotic images of Caleb that my own fiance put into my brain.
Rafe: I'm sorry.

Alison: I don't want you to be 
sorry. I just want you to tell me because I honestly -- I don't know. How do you 
and I move on? How do you and I ever have "normal"?

Livvie: I knew it. I knew you 
wouldn't be able to resist me any more than you can go on denying your love for 
me. Don't stop, my darling. Please don't stop.

Stephen: Tell me why you want 
this.
Livvie: What?

Stephen: You tried to kill me. 
Why do you want me back now?

Livvie: Because I know now. I 
finally realize --
Stephen: Realize what?

Livvie: That you're the only 
man who's ever truly loved me for who I am, who accepts me good, bad, and no 
matter what.

Stephen: You betrayed me. You 
destroyed me. I can't forget that. I won't forget it.

Livvie: No, Caleb. Please, 
wait, please. I need you. I need things to be the way they once were.

Stephen: It's not possible. 
They can never be the way they were.

Livvie: Yes, it can. Come on. 
With you, anything is possible. Just tell me -- what do I have to do to win your 
love again, to have you back completely?
Stephen: Beg.
[Music plays]

Lucy: Oh, those are lovely. I 
have Kevin's favorite flowers. He loves that color. And I have his favorite 
candles and that scent. And I have his favorite music playing. And -- oh, I bet 
he's going to be starving when he comes home. I will order takeout from that 
little Italian restaurant he likes. You know, I have a menu in here somewhere. I 
know I do. I got -- oh, goodness' sake. I got one. What, what -- what am I 
doing? I'm acting silly. That's what I'm doing. This is ridiculous. This is not 
like a first date. This is my husband coming home, and everything's going to be 
just fine. If I want things to get better, I can't force it. I just have to let 
it happen. If we're going to get together, then it --
[Door opens]
Lucy: Hey!
Kevin: Hey!

Lucy: Hi. I was getting 
worried. Where have you been?

Kevin: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't 
even think you'd be home yet.

Lucy: Well, I -- I just sort of 
-- I wanted to make things nice.

Kevin: Yeah, and you sure did. 
The place looks great.
Lucy: Good. Thanks.

So, where were you? Spent all 
this time with Victor, huh?

Kevin: Most of it, yeah, and 
the rest of the time I was tying up some loose ends.
Lucy: "Loose ends"?

Kevin: Lucy, things don't look 
very good. I mean, Victor's tried, but --

Lucy: The woman does not want 
to drop those charges, does she?
Kevin: Can you blame her?
Lucy: No, I guess not, no.

Kevin: Hey, let's -- let's just 
try not to worry yet, ok?

Lucy: Ok, I'll try. I'm trying. 
It's just I want to do something. You know me -- I got to do something, and I 
just wish I could go to the woman and say, "Look, you don't understand. When 
Kevin attacked you like that, it was because he wasn't himself," that you're all 
better now.

Kevin: But the fact is I did 
hurt her, Lucy. And I have to pay for that, one way or the other.

Lucy: Then I guess what we will 
do is just hope for some sort of miracle, huh?

Kevin: Whatever happens, I love 
you. Don't ever forget that, ok?

Lucy: Of course not. Doc, what 
-- what happened? Your wrist -- it's all scratched. What -- how did you get 
those?

Kevin: This scratch? I -- I 
must've gotten this leaving the hospital.
Lucy: How?

Kevin: I don't know! I'm sorry, 
I'm -- I'm sorry, Lucy. It's just been a very difficult day.

Lucy: Why -- why don't I get 
some antiseptic and I'll clean that up. It looks pretty bad.

Kevin: No, no, no. Actually, 
there's something -- something I want to say.
Lucy: Ok. What?
Kevin: Uh -- thank you.

Lucy: "Thank you"? I haven't 
gone to get anything yet to fix that.

Kevin: No, not -- not about 
that. I mean, thank you for everything. I don't deserve you, Lucy.

Lucy: You're my husband, I am 
your wife, and I love you. And all I want out of any of this is just to get our 
lives back. I want it to be like it was before all this happened.
Kevin: God, I love you so much.
Lucy: I love you, too.
[Doorbell rings]

Kevin: Timing. Victor. Come on 
in.

Victor: Monk, I'm so sorry to 
interrupt your evening. I know I said I'd call.

Kevin: It's all right, it's all 
right.

Lucy: Victor, it's all right. 
What -- what's going on? What's happened?

Victor: I have some news about 
the woman Kevin assaulted.
Lucy: Fine. Then just say it.

Victor: Well, you -- you might 
want to sit down. It's a shocker.

Rafe: I -- I can't stop 
believing what I do about Stephen, but you're right. I shouldn't have forced my 
thoughts on you, especially the way that I did, and I'm sorry. And you're right 
about something else. You know, if we're going to have a future together, if 
we're going to have a life together, then the last thing I want is for you to be 
scared and worried every time you close your eyes and go to sleep. And you're 
not going to have to be, I promise, because what happened today will never 
happen again.

Alison: It's not that easy, 
Rafe, and you know it.

Rafe: Why -- why isn't it? Why 
can't it be? Why --

Alison: Because you said it so 
yourself. I mean, sometimes this happens without you even knowing it. I mean --
Rafe: But it won't --

Alison: If you wish it hard 
enough, it --

Rafe: It -- no, no, no. It 
won't. I promise you. I promise you I will control it and this will never happen 
again.

Alison: I know you will try. I 
know that. And I want to move on.
Rafe: We can.

Alison: I know it was just a 
dream. I know that. I have these images in my head of Caleb. Rafe, it was so 
real. And it was one of those things that was so awful. I just keep picturing 
him biting me and drinking my blood, and I'm scared.
Rafe: It's all right.
Alison: I'm just scared.
Rafe: It's ok.

Livvie: Ever since you came 
back to Port Charles, I've been hit with all these memories of what it was like 
to be with you. I tried fighting them, fighting the constant pull to you that 
every day would just get stronger and stronger. But I couldn't. And I still 
can't. Caleb, you told me that love in this world is fleeting and temporary but 
your love was infinite and forever. So if that is true, then it must also be 
true that you still love me, that you still long for me the way I long for you. 
So I am begging you, take me. Make me your bride again, and I will never, ever 
betray you again.
Stephen: Olivia.

Livvie: You do want me, don't 
you, Caleb? Please take me. Show me how much.

Lucy: Victor, just -- please, 
just say it. What is -- what's going to happen to Kevin?

Victor: Absolutely nothing. 
He's totally off the hook.
Kevin: What?
Lucy: What?

Victor: The girl is dropping 
all the charges. It's over.
Lucy: Thank God!

Kevin: Wait a minute. What -- 
what made her change her mind?

Victor: All she told the police 
was that she wanted to put this behind her, get on with her life. As a matter of 
fact, she's leaving Port Charles tonight for good.

Lucy: Oh, Victor, thank you. 
Doc! Oh, my God, Doc! Do you see what this is? This is the miracle I was hoping 
for, and everything is going to be all right. I know it.

Kevin: I know it, too. I -- I 
just can't believe this! It's finally over and we can get back on with our 
lives.

Victor: I'm going to leave you 
and let you get back on --

Kevin: Wait, wait just a 
minute... how do I ever thank you?

Victor: You don't have to thank 
me. I got my son back. That's all the thanks I need.
Lucy: Oh!

Victor: Oh. Have a lovely rest 
of the evening. Welcome home.

Kevin: Yeah. You know, it 
finally feels like I am.

Lucy: Doc, home. It's really 
true. You're finally home for good.
Kevin: I can't believe it.

Lucy: Neither can I. It's like 
the universe just gave us what we asked for. Now everything's going to be ok and 
get back to normal.
Kevin: How about that universe.

Rafe: I love you. You know 
that, right?
Alison: I love you, too.

Rafe: And I promise that you'll 
never be afraid again.

Alison: Rafe -- as hard as all 
this has been to understand, I do know one thing -- I know that you love me.
Rafe: You better know that.
Alison: I love you.
Alison: Good night.
Rafe: Good night. Sweet dreams.
Alison: Sweet dreams.

Alison: Do you mind if maybe, 
just for tonight, that we sleep with the light on?
Rafe: No.
Alison: Ok.
Rafe: Of course not.

Livvie: Do it, Caleb. I'm 
begging you, please. I need to feel close to you, as close as I possibly can.
[Stephen laughs]
Livvie: What are you doing?

Stephen: Oh. My gosh, you're 
unbelievable.

Livvie: What's going on? What 
is this?

Stephen: I'm sorry. I just -- I 
can't go through with this. As much as I would love to, it's just too easy and 
it got way too freaky in the end.
Livvie: What are you saying?

Stephen: I'm saying it was a 
gag, Livvie. For the millionth time, I'm not Caleb. I'm Stephen Clay.
[Stephen laughs]

Stephen: And you know, as much 
as I would love to sleep with you, I'm leaving so you can get dressed. Then get 
out.

Livvie: So you still want to 
play, Caleb? Ok. I'll be patient because I got all the time in the world.

Stay tuned for scenes from the 
next "Port Charles: Naked Eyes."

Elizabeth: I really don't think

Rafe: I lose the magic or I

Kevin: I can tell by looking at
